[SYNTAX]: Overly complex, archaic sentence structures (e.g., "Was it not accepted by all of us--the enlightened and emancipated men of science...") may impede readability for modern readers.
[LEXICON]: Archaic vocabulary ("animalcular," "quasi-biological") and formal tone require concentrated attention.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transitions between personal anecdote (e.g., father’s friend’s critique) and abstract philosophical analysis (e.g., differentiation/integration).
[CLARITY]: Assumes prior knowledge of Spencer’s works (e.g., "the germinal essay of 1857") and historical context (e.g., "the Nonconformist of 1842").

[SYNTAX]: Severe grammatical errors (e.g., "It men urged to be will scientific...")
[PHRASING]: Awkward sentence structure (e.g., "Was as that to main contribution...")

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt insertion of final quoted statements without contextual lead-in
[STRUCTURE]: Assumed background knowledge of Spencer’s works without explanation
